```{r}
rm(list=ls())
data=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/CASE/Beijing2009.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
m=0
d1=0
d2=0
d3=0
d4=0
d5=0
d6=0
v=data$Value
for(i in 1:length(v)){
  if(v[i]==-999)
    m=m+1
  else if(v[i]>=0&v[i]<=35)
    d1=d1+1
  else if(v[i]>35&v[i]<=75)
    d2=d2+1
  else if(v[i]>75&v[i]<=115)
    d3=d3+1
  else if(v[i]>115&v[i]<=150)
    d4=d4+1
  else if(v[i]>150&v[i]<250)
    d5=d5+1
  else if(v[i]>=250)
    d6=d6+1
}
pie=c(m,d1,d2,d3,d4,d5,d6)
labels <- c("Missing Value", "0~35μg/m³", "35~75μg/m³", "75~115μg/m³","115~150μg/m³","150~250μg/m³",">=250μg/m³")
piepercent<- paste(round(100*pie/sum(pie), 2), "%")
pie(pie, labels = piepercent, main = "The percentage of PM 2.5 distribution in 2008",col = c('gray1','springgreen','olivedrab','khaki','hotpink','chocolate','darkred'))
legend("topright", c("Missing Value", "0~35μg/m³", "35~75μg/m³", "75~115μg/m³","115~150μg/m³","150~250μg/m³",">=250μg/m³"), cex = 0.8,fill = c('gray1','springgreen','olivedrab','khaki','hotpink','chocolate','darkred'))
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
rm(list=ls())
data2008=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2008.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2009=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2009.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2010=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2010.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2011=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2011.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2012=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2012.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2013=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2013.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2014=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2014.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2015=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2015.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2016=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2016.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
data2017=read.csv(file='/Users/fukang/Downloads/DATADM/Beijing2017.csv',header=TRUE,sep=',')
p <- plot_ly(data2010, x = as.factor(data2010$Month), y = ~data2010$Value,name = '2010',type = 'bar') %>%
  add_trace(data2011, x = as.factor(data2011$Month), y = ~data2011$Value,name='2011') %>%
  add_trace(data2012, x = as.factor(data2012$Month), y = ~data2012$Value,name='2012') %>%
  add_trace(data2013, x = as.factor(data2013$Month), y = ~data2013$Value,name='2013') %>%
  add_trace(data2014, x = as.factor(data2014$Month), y = ~data2014$Value,name='2014') %>%
  add_trace(data2015, x = as.factor(data2015$Month), y = ~data2015$Value,name='2015') %>%
  add_trace(data2016, x = as.factor(data2016$Month), y = ~data2016$Value,name='2016') %>%
  layout(yaxis = list(title = 'accumulative PM2.5 Value'),xaxis = list(title = 'Month'), barmode = 'stack')
p
```

When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the *Preview* button or press *Cmd+Shift+K* to preview the HTML file).
